seller_description: Product Description: Featuring everyone's favorite flavors together in one place, the Sparkling Ice Purple Pack (Black Raspberry, Cherry Limeade, Orange Mango, and Kiwi Strawberry) includes four refreshing, zero-sugar flavors to keep you hydrated and happy. Sparkling Ice is a fizzy, flavorful sparkling water, without all the calories. Sparkling Ice flavored sparkling water contains 0g sugar, only 5 calories per bottle, and 0g carbs. Made with better-for-you ingredients, this low-calorie carbonated water is bursting with real fruit flavor, is made with colors from natural sources, and contains vitamins and antioxidants. The product ships in a pack of 12 bottles. Each sparkling water bottle contains 17 fl oz. Manufacturer Contact Information. Talking Rain Beverage Company P.O. Box 549 Preston, WA 98050. Product details. Is Discontinued By Manufacturer : No. Product Dimensions : 9.9 x 9.1 x 7.3 inches; 14.75 ounces. Item model number : FG00068. UPC : 016571950927. Manufacturer : Talking Rain Beverage Company. ASIN : B00F9VCQ2A. Country of Origin : USA
review: I love this brand and their flavors unfortunately I received an expired batch! They have no gas when we open them and as you can clearly see they were expired since November of last year. Will be asking for a refund!
expected-output: Seller Image and Description: The seller’s images show an attractive array of flavors for Sparkling Ice, emphasizing freshness, zero sugar, natural colors, vitamins, and antioxidants. The description highlights that it’s a pack of 12 bottles, each offering a refreshing, low-calorie sparkling water experience. Buyer Image: The buyer’s image shows bottles with an expiration date clearly printed on them, indicating they expired in November of the previous year. This image directly supports the buyer's claim of expired products. Buyer Review: The buyer expresses disappointment due to receiving expired bottles. They mention that the drinks “have no gas” when opened, suggesting a loss of carbonation, which would be expected from expired carbonated beverages. The buyer is clearly dissatisfied and intends to request a refund. Analysis: The buyer’s complaint is valid and highlights a significant discrepancy between the seller's promise of a fresh, fizzy product and the reality of receiving expired items. The fault here lies with the seller or distributor for sending a batch past its expiration, impacting the buyer's experience. Conclusion: The buyer is dissatisfied due to receiving expired goods, which does not meet the expectations set by the seller’s description. The seller is responsible, as expired products should not be sold to consumers, especially when freshness and quality are key selling points. A refund or replacement would be an appropriate resolution in this case." The buyer's dissatisfaction is justified due to receiving expired Sparkling Ice bottles, contradicting the seller’s promise of a fresh, carbonated product. The expired date and lack of fizz upon opening indicate that the product’s quality was compromised, likely due to poor inventory management or distribution oversight. This situation places responsibility on the seller or distributor for ensuring that only fresh items are shipped. A refund or replacement would be a suitable resolution to address the buyer’s experience.
label: 0:Here seller is at fault
